intro: Apiopetalum pennelii, commonly known as the yellow-flowered bellflower, is a rare and striking member of the Campanulaceae family. Native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile, this plant thrives in cool, moist environments. It is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant features a short, upright stem with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery down. Apiopetalum pennelii is notable for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in botanical gardens for its unique appearance.
